intro: Satureja amissa, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties. Satureja amissa thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
